decks.notes: This deck emphasizes control over the game by utilizing a combination of removal spells, counterspells, and board wipes to disrupt the opponent's strategy. It also includes powerful card advantage engines like Alrund's Epiphany and Emergent Ultimatum to pull ahead in the late game. The inclusion of Yorion, Sky Nomad as a companion allows for extra value through blinking permanents for additional ETB effects. Overall, the deck aims to outlast the opponent and overwhelm them with powerful threats like Vorinclex, Monstrous Raider and Valki, God of Lies.

This deck focuses on quickly putting pressure on the opponent by playing aggressive creatures like Goldspan Dragon and Bonecrusher Giant. The deck also includes cards like The Akroan War and Kazuul's Fury to control the battlefield and disrupt the opponent's game plan. Showdown of the Skalds and Village Rites provide card advantage and consistency to keep up the pressure. The deck aims to finish the game quickly by utilizing combat tricks like Unleash Fury and Claim the Firstborn. The mana base is designed to support the aggressive nature of the deck.

The main idea of this deck is to quickly overwhelm the opponent with aggressive red creatures and powerful equipment, supported by snow lands to enable additional synergies. By playing efficient cards like Torbran, Thane of Red Fell and Embercleave, the deck aims to deal damage swiftly and efficiently, with the goal of closing out the game before the opponent can stabilize. The inclusion of snow lands and Faceless Haven allows for additional versatility and resilience in combat, making it a formidable force in one-on-one matches.

The deck aims to quickly build a board presence and put pressure on the opponent through early aggressive creatures like Lovestruck Beast and Bonecrusher Giant, supported by card advantage engines like Edgewall Innkeeper. Key spells like Alrund's Epiphany and Goldspan Dragon provide reach and make finishing blows, while countermagic like Disdainful Stroke and disruption spells like Fire Prophecy help control the board and protect the deck's threats. Fabled Passage and various pathways ensure consistent mana fixing and enable smooth curve progression for a fast and efficient aggro strategy.

This deck focuses on aggressive creatures that have cycling abilities to trigger additional effects and generate card advantage. By cycling through cards quickly, the player can gain incremental advantages while also building towards a powerful finisher like Zenith Flare. The deck also includes various pathways for mana fixing and some disruption tools like Memory Leak to control the opponent's game plan. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a mix of creatures, combat tricks, and burn spells for a swift victory.

The main idea behind this deck is to quickly overwhelm and outpace the opponent with aggressive creatures and powerful cards like Embercleave. By consistently dealing damage early on and maximizing the use of creatures with various abilities, the goal is to put pressure on the opponent and dominate the field. Additionally, the inclusion of snow-covered mountains allows for the use of frost bite as removal, providing more control over the board and ensuring victory through relentless attack strategies.

This deck focuses on aggressive gameplay, putting pressure on the opponent with low-cost creatures and powerful damage-dealing cards. By utilizing cards like Rimrock Knight and Torbran, Thane of Red Fell, along with equipment like Embercleave, the deck aims to end the game quickly through direct damage and combat. The inclusion of Snow-Covered Mountains allows for the use of Frost Bite, further enhancing the deck's ability to control the board and pave the way for swift victories.

The deck focuses on overwhelming the opponent with fast, aggressive creatures like Fervent Champion, Robber of the Rich, and Bonecrusher Giant. It also includes powerful equipment like Embercleave to further enhance the damage output. The inclusion of snow lands allows for Frost Bite to target creatures or players early on. The deck aims to quickly build a wide board presence and finish off the opponent with direct damage spells or combat damage from the creatures. It also includes some control elements like The Akroan War to disrupt the opponent's strategy.

The deck focuses on controlling the board through a combination of removal spells and enchantments like Doom Foretold and Elspeth's Nightmare. It aims to outvalue the opponent by utilizing Yorion, Sky Nomad as a companion to blink its permanents for additional value. The deck also includes powerful finishers like Archon of Sun's Grace and Dance of the Manse to close out the game. With a flexible mana base and a variety of answers, this control deck looks to grind out wins through card advantage and disruption.

The deck focuses on controlling the opponent's board and hand through a combination of removal spells, counterspells, and enchantments. The goal is to disrupt the opponent's game plan and outvalue them with cards like Doom Foretold and Dance of the Manse. Yorion, Sky Nomad serves as both a companion and a way to repeatedly blink powerful enter-the-battlefield triggers for additional value. The mana base is designed to support a variety of colors and ensure smooth mana development throughout the game.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly generate tokens and cycle through cards to reach key pieces like Zenith Flare for a strong finish. Improbable Alliance, Valiant Rescuer, and Flourishing Fox provide a constant stream of tokens, while cards like Drannith Stinger and Irencrag Pyromancer allow for direct damage. Cycling cards like Boon of the Wish-Giver and Startling Development help to fuel Zenith Flare, which can deliver a massive amount of damage to the opponent. Additionally, the mana base is optimized for flexibility and consistency. This deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive plays and efficient cycling.

The deck focuses on controlling the board through removal spells and counterspells while generating card advantage with cards like Behold the Multiverse and Shark Typhoon. It aims to stall the game until it can play powerful threats like Ugin, the Spirit Dragon and finish off the opponent with a combination of direct damage and powerful planeswalkers. The deck also includes utility lands like Castle Vantress and Crawling Barrens to help ensure the player has the resources they need to maintain control of the game.

This Mardu Aggro deck focuses on aggression and disruption, utilizing powerful creatures like Kroxa, Titan of Death's Hunger and Bonecrusher Giant to apply pressure on the opponent. Its key strength lies in its ability to swiftly close out games with efficient threats, while also disrupting the opponent's game plan with cards like Drannith Magistrate and Duress. Additionally, the inclusion of Jegantha, the Wellspring as a companion adds versatility and additional value to the deck. The mana base is carefully constructed to support the aggressive game plan and ensure consistent mana fixing.

This Naya Aggro deck focuses on putting early pressure on the opponent with efficient creatures like Brushfire Elemental and Bonecrusher Giant. The deck also includes powerful spells like Embercleave and Showdown of the Skalds to close out games quickly. With a mix of creature threats and powerful equipment, the deck aims to overwhelm opponents with a mix of aggression and versatility. The inclusion of cards like Giant Killer and Questing Beast also provides answers to common threats in the format, making the deck well-rounded and difficult to deal with.

This deck focuses on quickly building a board presence with efficient creatures and utilizing cards like Felidar Retreat and The Great Henge to generate value and overwhelm the opponent. By playing aggressive creatures like Giant Killer and Lovestruck Beast early on, the deck aims to establish dominance on the battlefield before transitioning into a mid to late-game strategy with powerful cards such as Toski, Bearer of Secrets and Lurrus of the Dream-Den. The deck also includes some control elements with cards like Kabira Takedown and Reidane, God of the Worthy to disrupt the opponent's strategy and secure victory.

The deck focuses on controlling the board through removal spells and counterspells while ramping up mana to cast powerful spells and creatures. It aims to outvalue the opponent by generating card advantage with cards like Emergent Ultimatum and Alrund's Epiphany. The inclusion of Yorion as a companion allows for additional card advantage and flexibility in the deck's strategy. Overall, the deck excels at controlling the game and setting up for powerful late-game plays to secure victory.
